domain.removeConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove the domain
domain.removeTips: The following resources were created or updated by the solution during importing domain, please choose to reverse or keep the related changes. Remove the domain from the solution will not delete the OpenSearch domain in the AWS account.
domain.removeErrorIngestionExists: Please make sure you delete all log ingestion pipelines that are ingesting logs into this domain before removing it.
domain.removeErrorSubstackUnderProcessing: The domain is associated with a stack that is under processing. Please remove the associated stack first.
domain.standByTips: The selected domain has enabled Multi-AZ with Standy deployment, at least two replicas are required.

proxy.name: Access Proxy
proxy.removeTips: Are you sure you want to delete the Access Proxy

list.clusterRed: ClusterStatus.red maximum is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.clusterYellow: ClusterStatus.yellow maximum is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.writeBlocked: Index writes blocked error occurs for >= x times in 5 minutes, 1 consecutive time. Input `0` to disable this alarm.
list.nodeUnreachable: Nodes minimum is < x for 1 day, 1 consecutive time
list.snapshotFailed: AutomatedSnapshotFailure maximum is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.cpuUtilization: CPUUtilization or WarmCPUUtilization maximum is >= 80% for 15 minutes, 3 consecutive times
list.jvmMemory: JVMMemoryPressure or WarmJVMMemoryPressure maximum is >= 80% for 5 minutes, 3 consecutive times
list.masterCPU: MasterCPUUtilization maximum is >= 50% for 15 minutes, 3 consecutive times
list.masterJVM: MasterJVMMemoryPressure maximum is >= 80% for 15 minutes, 1 consecutive time
list.kmsKeyDisabled: KMSKeyError is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.kmsKeyInAccess: KMSKeyInaccessible is >= 1 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time

alarms.name: Alarms
alarms.removeTips: Are you sure you want to delete the Alarm

alarm.name: Create alarms
alarm.domainAlarmDesc: By enabling CloudWatch Alarms, you will receive notification of the status of the Amazon OpenSearch domain.  This is the recommended alarms by Amazon OpenSearch Service. The created alarms will be sent to the same SNS Topic.
alarm.emailDesc: Notification will be sent to this email. Please click the link in your email to validate the email address.
alarm.emailFormatError: Email must be a validate format
alarm.selectAlarmTips: Please at least select one alarm option

proxy.name: Create access proxy
proxy.publicProxyDesc: Access Proxy is a Forward proxy to access the OpenSearch dashboards within the VPC. Enabling the proxy will create an ELB associated Nginx Auto Scaling Group and route web traffics from Internet to the OpenSearch built-in dashboards.
proxy.publicSubnetsDesc: Select at least 2 subnets of the log processing layer. The Subnet must be connected to the Cluster.
proxy.publicSGDesc: Select a Security Group for the Application Load Balancer. This Security Group must have access to the Log Processing Security Group.
proxy.domainNameDesc: Input a domain name to associate with the access proxy. You will need to access the proxy via this domain.
proxy.domainNameFormatError: Domain Name required and must be a domain format.
proxy.lbSSLDesc1: Select the SSL certificate associated with the above domain name. You must create certificate in
proxy.nginxKeyNameDesc1: Choose an existing EC2 key listed in
proxy.subnetError: Please choose at least 2 public subnets.
proxy.secureConnDesc: Connect the access proxy with HTTPS. You will need to have a Domain and SSL Certificate.
proxy.unsecureTips: The access proxy created will be accessed using unsecured connection. You will need to delete and re-create the access proxy if you change your mind later.
proxy.ackTips: I acknowledge that I choose to use unsecured connection.
proxy.ackError: Please acknowledge all checkboxes before proceeding.

selectDomain.domainDesc1: The domain must be in the same region as this solution. Follow
selectDomain.domainDesc3: to create a cluster if you donâ€™t have one in the region. (Notes that only domains with Active status is able to import)
selectDomain.checkDomainInProgressDesc: Evaluate if the selected domain can be imported into this solution
selectDomain.checkDomainPassDesc: The selected domain meets the requirements to be imported into this solution.
selectDomain.checkDomainErrorDesc: The selected domain did not meet one or more requirements, please change the domain configuration or select a different domain.
selectDomain.alertDomainVersion: The version of the OpenSearch domain needs to be higher than v1.3.0.
selectDomain.alertDomainEngineType: Only OpenSearch engine type is currently supported.
selectDomain.alertDomainInVpc: Requires the domain deployed within a VPC.
selectDomain.alertSolutionPrivateNAT: The private subnet for the Solution requires NAT.

configNetwork.autoDesc: Create a dedicated VPC for log processing layer and public access layer to connect to the OpenSearch domain via VPC peering.
configNetwork.manualDesc: Manually specify the log processing layer and public access layer network settings.
configNetwork.layerNetworkDesc: Solution requires one Log Processing Subnet Group. The log processing functions will reside in the log processing subnet and use the associated Security Group.
configNetwork.configTipDesc: You have chosen a VPC other than the VPC of the selected OpenSearch domain. Please create VPC Peering, configure Route Table, and make sure the resources have access to the domain.
configNetwork.vpcDesc: Select the VPC of the log processing layer. The VPC must be the same VPC as the cluster or connected via VPC Peering.
configNetwork.logProcessSubnetGroupDesc: Select at least two subnets of the log processing layer. It is recommended to select private subnets.
configNetwork.logProcessSGDesc: Select a Security Group for the log processing layer. The Security Group must have access the OpenSearch domain.

imported.updateSG: Update security group of the OpenSearch domain:
imported.updateDomainNACL: Update Network ACL of the OpenSearch domain:
imported.updateDomainRouteTable: Update route tables of the OpenSearch domain:
imported.updateSolutionRouteTable: Update route tables of the solution vpc:
imported.checkSG: Check security group of the OpenSearch domain:
imported.done: Your domain has been imported successfully!

check.dueTo: Fail to connect to selected OpenSearch domain due to:
check.chooseAnother: Please update OpenSearch domain setting or select another domain.

failed.DOMAIN_NETWORK_TYPE_NOT_PRIVATE: Domain's network type is not private.
failed.SUBNET_WITHOUT_NAT: Lack of NAT in domain's subnets.
failed.AOS_SECURITY_GROUP_CHECK_FAILED: Domain's security group is blocking connectivity.
failed.VPC_PEERING_CHECK_FAILED: Lack of VPC peering between solution's VPC and domain's VPC.
failed.AOS_VPC_ROUTING_CHECK_FAILED: Domain's VPC route table misses rule to route traffic to solution' VPC.
failed.SOLUTION_VPC_ROUTING_CHECK_FAILED: Solution's VPC route table misses rule to route traffic to domain' VPC.
